unnormalised: EdTech startup 'ShikshaVerse' secures $5M in Series A funding, led by Sequoia Capital India, as reported on 17/08/2024. The funding round also saw participation from existing investors like Blume Ventures & AngelList India. ShikshaVerse, founded by IIT Delhi alumni Rohan Sharma & Priya Patel in 2018, aims to bridge the gap in affordable quality education, particularly in Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities.
normalised: EdTech startup 'ShikshaVerse' secures dollar five million in Series A funding, led by Sequoia Capital India, as reported on seventeenth august two thousand and twenty four. The funding round also saw participation from existing investors like Blume Ventures and AngelList India. ShikshaVerse, founded by I-I-T Delhi alumni Rohan Sharma and Priya Patel in two thousand and eighteen, aims to bridge the gap in affordable quality education, particularly in Tier two and Tier three cities.

unnormalised: The company's flagship product, 'LearnSmart,' an AI-powered personalized learning platform, boasts 500,000+ active users and offers courses ranging from K-12 to competitive exam preparation like JEE and NEET. Parents are seeing results, with average score improvements of 15% reported after just 6 months of using LearnSmart, according to internal data.
normalised: The company's flagship product, 'LearnSmart,' an A-I-powered personalized learning platform, boasts five hundred thousand plus active users and offers courses ranging from K-twelve to competitive exam preparation like J-E-E and N-E-E-T. Parents are seeing results, with average score improvements of fifteen percent reported after just six months of using LearnSmart, according to internal data.

unnormalised: This latest round of funding will be used to expand LearnSmart’s curriculum, develop vernacular language support for Hindi, Tamil, and Bengali, and scale its teacher training programs. ShikshaVerse plans to add over 200 teachers to its network in the next 12 months. Currently, the platform has 50+ subjects and caters to students from Std. 1 to Std. 12.
normalised: This latest round of funding will be used to expand LearnSmart’s curriculum, develop vernacular language support for Hindi, Tamil, and Bengali, and scale its teacher training programs. ShikshaVerse plans to add over two hundred teachers to its network in the next twelve months. Currently, the platform has fifty plus subjects and caters to students from Standard one to Standard twelve.

unnormalised: "We are thrilled to have Sequoia Capital India onboard," said Rohan Sharma, CEO of ShikshaVerse. "This investment will enable us to reach more students across India and provide them with access to high-quality, affordable education. We aim to impact 1 million students by 2026." The company is also exploring partnerships with government schools to integrate LearnSmart into the curriculum.

unnormalised: Experts believe the EdTech market in India is poised for significant growth, projecting a market size of $10 billion by 2025. The COVID-19 pandemic accelerated the adoption of online learning, and companies like ShikshaVerse are well-positioned to capitalize on this trend. They plan on releasing version 2.0 of the 'LearnSmart' app on 01/01/2025 with many UI/UX improvements.
